acute respiratory distress syndrome.Descricao: (syn.) ARDS   Respiratory disease characterized by the rapid onset of widespread inflammation in the lungs.

adaptive immunity.Descricao: (syn.) acquired immunity   Immunity acquired during a personâ€™s lifetime upon exposure to an infectious agent either by previous infection or immunization.

aerosol.Descricao: Suspension of solid or liquid particles in a gas.

ageusia.Descricao: Disorder characterized by loss of taste.

airborne transmission.Descricao: (syn.) aerosol transmission   Mode of indirect transmission of an infectious disease that occurs when an infectious agent is carried by dust or droplet nuclei suspended in the air in the form of aerosols.

angiotensin-converting enzyme.Descricao: (syn.) ACE   Class of ectoenzymes found in, e.g., the lungs, heart, skin, or blood vessels, whose function is to cleave circulating peptides, among which angiotensinogen, which are then used to regulate specific cell functions.

anosmia.Descricao: Disorder characterized by loss of smell.

antibody.Descricao: (syn.) immunoglobulin   Protein produced by B lymphocytes that can recognize and neutralize an antigen.

antigen.Descricao: Particle, typically a protein, which the immune system recognizes as foreign.

asymptomatic transmission.Descricao: Mode of transmission of an infectious disease to another person from an infected person who does not develop symptoms.

attack rate.Descricao: Proportion of people that contract a disease in a population initially free of the disease, i.e. during a disease outbreak.

basic reproduction number.Descricao: (syn.) basic reproduction ratio, basic reproductive ratio, ğ‘…â‚€Average number of secondary cases that one case produces in a population at risk.

biostatistics.Descricao: Application of statistical methods and tools to the fields of biological sciences and medicine, including study design, data collection and analysis, and interpretation of findings.

blood plasma.Descricao: (syn.) plasma   Liquid part of the blood in which red and white blood cells and platelets are suspended and which carries such blood cells as well as proteins, mineral salts, sugars, fats, and hormones throughout the body.

case.Descricao: Person who is diagnosed as having a disease.

case definition.Descricao: Set of criteria used to decide whether a person has contracted a specific disease.

case fatality rate.Descricao: (syn.) CFR Proportion of people who die of a given disease out of all the confirmed cases.

casual contact.Descricao: Person who has been in the proximity of a person affected by an infectious disease but does not live with or care for the infected person.

chain of infection.Descricao: Process in which an infectious agent leaves its reservoir or host through a portal of exit, is conveyed by a mode of transmission, and enters a susceptible host through a portal of entry.

chloroquine.Descricao: Quinoline that is substituted at position 4 by a [5-(diethylamino)pentan-2-yl]amino group and at position 7 by chlorine and is used for the treatment of e.g. malaria, lupus erythematosus, and rheumatoid arthritis.

close contact.Descricao: Person who lives with, cares for, or has direct contact with the respiratory secretions or body fluids of, a person affected by an infectious disease.

cluster.Descricao: (syn.) disease cluster   Aggregation of cases of a disease within a given place and time.

computed tomography.Descricao: (syn.) computer-assisted tomography, computerized tomography, CT   Medical imaging technique by which three-dimensional images of the body are obtained by directing a beam of x-rays at the patient and quickly rotating them around the patientâ€™s body, producing cross-sectional images that are then stacked together by a computed tomography scanner.

confirmed case.Descricao: Case that is confirmed by a laboratory test.

contact.Descricao: Person who has been in the proximity of another person affected by an infectious disease and who is at risk of having contracted this disease.

contact follow-up.Descricao: Process of monitoring the contacts of a case for symptoms of the disease.

contact identification.Descricao: Process aimed at identifying all contacts of a case by asking about the activities of the case and the activities and roles of the people around the case since the onset of the disease.

contact tracing.Descricao: Process of identification, listing and follow-up of contacts.

containment.Descricao: Strategy adopted by a public body to cut off transmission of a disease.

convalescent plasma therapy.Descricao: Therapeutic treatment whereby the blood plasma donated by individuals who have recovered from an infectious disease is introduced into the blood of people who are suffering from the same disease in order to help control the symptoms and limit the progression of the disease.

Traducoes.FR: utilisation thÃ©rapeutique de plasma de convalescents

coronavirus.Descricao: (syn.) CoV   Family of viruses that consist of a core comprising a positive-sense single-stranded RNA, an envelope, a capsid, and spikes.

coronavirus disease 2019.Descricao: (syn.) COVID-19   Infectious disease caused by SARS-CoV-2.

cough reflex.Descricao: Body's natural response to help clear irritants from the airways.

cytokine release syndrome.Descricao: (syn.) CRS   Systemic inflammatory response syndrome caused by a large and rapid release of cytokines into the blood, which may be triggered by different factors, e.g. a viral infection or the use of certain drugs in immunotherapy.

death-to-case ratio.Descricao: Number of deaths attributed to a particular disease in a specified period divided by the number of new cases of the disease identified during the same period.

Traducoes.ES: razÃ³n de muertes por casos nuevos
Traducoes.KO: ì‹ ê·œ  í™•ì§„ì  ëŒ€ë¹„  ì‹ ê·œ  ì‚¬ë§ì  ë¹„ìœ¨

direct contact transmission.Descricao: Mode of transmission that occurs when an infectious agent is transferred from a reservoir to a host by direct contact or droplet transmission.

disease.Descricao: Abnormal condition that has a negative impact on the structure or function of all or part of an organism, generally associated with certain signs and symptoms.

disease outbreak.Descricao: Cluster of a disease with a common cause and an overall number of cases that is inferior to that of an epidemic.

deoxyribonucleic acid.Descricao: (syn.) DNA   Double-stranded nucleic acid whose nucleotides consist of a backbone made up by a modified sugar, called deoxyribose, a nitrogenous base, i.e. adenine, guanine, cytosine, and thymine, and a phosphate group.

drive-through testing.Descricao: Method of performing swab tests on people whilst they remain in their vehicles.

Traducoes.RU: Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñƒ Â«Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¼Ğ°ÑˆĞ¸Ğ½Ñ‹Â»

droplet nucleus.Descricao: Dried residue, approximately â‰¤ 5 Î¼m in diameter, which results from the evaporation of droplets coughed or sneezed into the air.

droplet transmission.Descricao: (syn.) droplet spread   Mode of direct transmission of an infectious disease that occurs when a person is in the proximity of an infected person who has respiratory symptoms, e.g., via coughing, sneezing, breathing, or talking.

elimination.Descricao: (syn.) suppression, elimination strategy   Strategy adopted by a public body to reduce to zero the incidence of a disease in a given geographical area.

endemic disease.Descricao: Disease for which there are as many cases as would be expected in a given population at a given time.
endemic disease.Categoria: MEDI, Public health & hygiene Public health & hygiene

environmental cleaning.Descricao: Set of actions and processes, including cleaning, disinfecting and monitoring, implemented in places at risk of spread of an infectious agent through contaminated objects.

epidemic curve.Descricao: Graphical representation of the incidence of a disease or other health-related event plotted over time.

epidemic disease.Descricao: Disease for which there are many more cases than would be expected at a given time in a given population and which can be ascribed to the same cause.

epidemic threshold.Descricao: Number of individuals within a population at risk that is required for an epidemic to occur.

epidemiology.Descricao: Scientific study of the occurrence of a disease or other health-related event in specified populations, and its application to the control of health problems.

fever.Descricao: (syn.) pyrexia   Innate immune response mechanism that increases a personâ€™s body temperature above the normal level.

filtering facepiece respirator.Descricao: (syn.) filtering face-piece respirator, FFR Respiratory protective equipment that uses filters to remove hazardous substances from the air being breathed by the wearer.

fomite.Descricao: Inanimate object contaminated by an infectious agent that can indirectly transmit an infectious disease.

full face shield.Descricao: (syn.) face shield (syn.) full-face visor (syn.) visor   Personal protective equipment that protects the wearerâ€™s eyes and face from sprays, splashes, and large-particle droplets, and prevents the spread of respiratory droplets from the wearer to others.

gene.Descricao: Sequence of DNA that carries the required information for making a specific molecule, typically a protein.

gene therapy.Descricao: Therapeutic treatment whereby one or more foreign genes are inserted into the genome of an organism by means of a vector, to compensate for abnormal genes or to help the organism produce a protein that can be beneficial for it.

genome.Descricao: Complete set of DNA of a living organism, including all of its genes.

hand sanitizer.Descricao: Gel, foam, or liquid used for handwashing that may or may not contain alcohol.

hand washing.Descricao: Action of removing any unwanted substance or microorganism from a person's hands using water or another liquid, with or without soap or other detergents.

herd immunity.Descricao: (syn.) community immunity   Indirect protection from an infectious agent achieved in a population at risk when a sufficiently large proportion of individuals in the population show an acquired immunity to that infectious agent.

high-risk group.Descricao: Part of a population at risk that has higher than average prevalence, incidence or severity of a disease.

hospital gown.Descricao: Garment of personal protective equipment worn in healthcare settings to reduce the risk of exposure to infectious agents.

hospitalization.Descricao: Admission and stay of a patient in a hospital for treatment.

host.Descricao: Person or animal infected by an infectious agent.

hygiene.Descricao: Set of practices that help to maintain health and prevent the spread of diseases.

immune response.Descricao: Reaction of the immune system of an organism to potentially harmful stimuli.

immune system.Descricao: Network of cells and antibodies that defends the body against the attack of agents perceived as extraneous and potentially harmful to it by triggering an immune response, which can be specific (adaptive) or not specific (innate).

immunity.Descricao: Condition of being protected against an infectious disease.

imported case.Descricao: Case who has a history of travel from an affected area some time before the onset of the disease and cannot be linked to local transmission.

incidence.Descricao: New cases of a disease arising in a given period in a population at risk.

incubation period.Descricao: Lapse of time between the exposure to an infectious agent and the onset of the symptoms of a disease.

index case.Descricao: (syn.) index patient   The first known case of the outbreak of a disease in a cluster.

indirect contact transmission.Descricao: Mode of transmission that occurs when an infectious agent is transferred from a reservoir to a host by means of a vehicle, i.e. water, food or air, a vector or a fomite.

infection fatality rate.Descricao: (syn.) IFR Proportion of people who will die of a certain disease out of all those who have been infected.

infectious agent.Descricao: Biological agent that may or may not cause an infectious disease.

infectivity.Descricao: Ability of an infectious agent to enter, survive, and multiply in a host.

inflammation.Descricao: Series of innate immunity processes initiated by the body in response to an injury.

intensive care unit.Descricao: (syn.) critical care unit, ICU, CCU   Hospital facility that provides critical care and life support for acutely ill or injured patients.

intubation.Descricao: (syn.) endotracheal intubation   Invasive lung ventilation method in which a tube is inserted into the patientâ€™s trachea through the mouth or nose.

laboratory test.Descricao: Diagnostic test performed on samples of a personâ€™s body, e.g. blood, urine, saliva, tissues, typically in specially equipped facilities.

lockdown.Descricao: (syn.) confinement   Strategy adopted by a public body because of an emergency that requires people to remain in a certain location which they may not leave other than for exceptional reasons.

magnetic resonance imaging.Descricao: (syn.) magnetic resonance tomography, nuclear magnetic resonance imaging, MRI, MRT, NMRI   Medical imaging technique by which three-dimensional images of the body are obtained by exciting protons present in the water of living tissues and detecting the change in the direction of their rotational axis by means of a magnetic resonance imaging scanner. MEDI,

mask.Descricao: Commercially produced or homemade covering for nose and mouth used to reduce the spread of respiratory droplets from the wearer to others.

mechanical ventilation.Descricao: Lung ventilation provided by driving fresh air into the lungs by positive pressure and/or by pumping expiratory air out of the lungs by negative pressure.

mechanical ventilator.Descricao: (syn.) ventilator   Machine that helps patients to breathe by driving fresh air into the lungs by positive pressure and/or by pumping expiratory air out of the lungs by negative pressure, replacing some or all of the muscular effort required for lung ventilation.

medical care.Descricao: Administration and delivery of healthcare by professionals.

medical glove.Descricao: Personal protective equipment for the hands typically worn by healthcare professionals to protect themselves from exposure to infectious agents or other biological, chemical or physical hazards.

mitigation.Descricao: Strategy adopted by a public body to reduce the number of infected people in a given geographical area and limit the impact on the health system of a disease outbreak.

mode of transmission.Descricao: (syn.) route of transmission   Means by which an infectious agent spreads from one host to another.

monoclonal antibody.Descricao: Laboratory-produced molecule that targets and attacks specific antigens, thereby triggering a specific immune response.

morbidity.Descricao: Level of health and well-being of an individual.

multiple organ failure.Descricao: (syn.) multiorgan failure, MOF   Inability of two or more organs or organ systems to perform their function.

nasopharyngeal swab test.Descricao: Method of collecting a specimen of nasal secretions for diagnostic purposes by inserting a swab into each nostril, extending it back into the nasopharynx, leaving it in place for a few seconds, and slowly withdrawing it with a rotating motion.

non-invasive ventilation.Descricao: (syn.) NIV   Positive pressure ventilation provided through a personâ€™s upper respiratory airways using an oxygen mask.

nucleotide sequence.Descricao: Sequence of the repeating units of DNA or RNA.

pandemic.Descricao: (syn.) pandemic disease   Epidemic disease that has spread to different countries and continents.

pandemic preparedness.Descricao: Ability of a public body to deal with a threat to human health caused by a pandemic by ensuring that appropriate response plans are in place.

personal protective equipment.Descricao: (syn.) PPE   Gear worn by an individual that provides protection against one or more risks to a personâ€™s health and safety.

pharmacoepidemiology.Descricao: Study of the use and effects of drugs in large numbers of people, the aim of which is to estimate the probability of positive or negative effects of a drug.

point-of-care testing.Descricao: (syn.) point-of-collection testing, POCT   Method of performing a laboratory test at or near the site of patient care.

polymerase chain reaction.Descricao: (syn.) PCR   Molecular biology technique that applies high temperature and a DNA polymerase to a sample of DNA containing the target sequence, thereby producing copies of small segments of the original DNA for use in further molecular and genetic analysis.

Traducoes.ES: reacciÃ³n en cadena de la polimerasa

portal of entry.Descricao: Anatomical site at which an infectious agent enters a host.

portal of exit.Descricao: Anatomical site at which an infectious agent leaves a host.

pre-symptomatic transmission.Descricao: Mode of transmission of an infectious disease to another person from an infected person who has not yet developed symptoms.

prevalence.Descricao: All cases of a disease observed at a given point in time in a population at risk.

primary case.Descricao: (syn.) patient zero   Case to whom the onset of the outbreak of a disease can be traced back.

probable case.Descricao: Case that is compatible with a clinical case definition and for whom there is strong epidemiological evidence of disease, e.g. the person is a contact of a confirmed case but no laboratory test confirmation is available.

public health.Descricao: Science of protecting and improving the health of people through the organized efforts of society by promoting a healthy lifestyle, preventing injuries, and preventing, detecting and responding to infectious diseases.

public health surveillance.Descricao: Ongoing systematic collection, analysis, and dissemination of health data to help guide public health decision making and action.

quarantine.Descricao: Strategy adopted by a public body to keep apart from the general population for a certain period of time all individuals suspected of having contact with a person affected by an infectious disease or coming from an affected area, until it is confirmed that they have not contracted the disease.

real-time reverse transcriptionpolymeras.Descricao: (syn.) real-time RT-PCR, rRT-PCR   Reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction in which detection and quantification of amplified DNA sequences are performed after each PCR cycle.

Traducoes.ES: reacciÃ³n en cadena de la polimerasa con transcripciÃ³n inversa en tiempo real
Traducoes.PT: reaÃ§Ã£o em cadeia da polimerase da transcriÃ§Ã£o reversa em tempo real
Traducoes.RU: Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ†ĞµĞ¿Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ€ĞµĞ°ĞºÑ†Ğ¸Ñ Ñ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹   Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¿Ñ†Ğ¸ĞµĞ¹ Ğ² Ñ€ĞµĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¸

reservoir.Descricao: Natural habitat in which an infectious agent normally lives, grows, and multiplies.

respiratory disease.Descricao: Disease affecting the airways and the lungs and hindering normal breathing, which may be caused by, e.g., infection, air pollution, or exposure to noxious substances.

respiratory droplet.Descricao: (syn.) droplet   Particle made of water, proteins, viral RNA, and non-volatile metabolites, which is >5-10 Î¼m in diameter and is exhaled from the nose and mouth of a person whilst e.g. coughing, sneezing breathing, or talking.

respiratory hygiene.Descricao: (syn.) cough etiquette   Set of practices and behaviours adopted by an individual with the aim of preventing the spread of respiratory diseases.

respiratory protective equipment.Descricao: (syn.) respirator (en-US), RPEPersonal protective equipment that protects the wearer against inhalation of hazardous substances in the air, such as dust, fumes, gases, or biological substances.

risk factor.Descricao: Characteristic, condition, or behaviour that increases the likelihood that a person will contract a disease or sustain an injury.

ribonucleic acid.Descricao: (syn.) RNA   Single-stranded nucleic acid whose nucleotides consist of a backbone made up by a simple sugar, called ribose, a phosphate group, and a nitrogenous base, i.e. adenine, guanine, cytosine, and uracil.

self-isolation.Descricao: (syn.) self-quarantine   Measure taken by an individual in order to avoid contact with other people and thus help to prevent the spread of an infectious disease.

sepsis.Descricao: Organ dysfunction syndrome caused by an impairment of the physiological regulatory mechanisms via which a host responds to infection.

septic shock.Descricao: Class of sepsis in which abnormalities of circulation, i.e. persistent hypotension despite fluid resuscitation, and/or of cellular metabolism are serious enough to increase mortality substantially.

serologic test.Descricao: (syn.) serological test, antibody test   Laboratory test aimed at detecting in the blood serum of an individual the presence of antibodies produced in response to a given disease. MEDI,

severe acute respiratory syndrome.Descricao: (syn.) SARS   Infectious disease caused by SARS-CoV-1.

Traducoes.ES: coronavirus del sÃ­ndrome respiratorio agudo grave 2
Traducoes.PT: coronavÃ­rus da sÃ­ndrome respiratÃ³ria aguda grave 2
Traducoes.RU: Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ€ÑƒÑ Ñ‚ÑĞ¶ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ€ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑĞ¸Ğ½Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ°

social distancing.Descricao: Strategy adopted by a public body to reduce physical contact and proximity between individuals in a community in order to reduce the risk of transmission of an infectious disease, for example by instructing or advising individuals to maintain a certain distance from each other or by prohibiting gatherings of more than a certain number of people.

spike glycoprotein.Descricao: (syn.) spike   Glycoprotein complex made up of three protomers and located on the envelope of coronaviruses, which enables the virus to bind to the receptor site of the host cells.

super-spreader.Descricao: Person affected by an infectious disease who transmits the disease to a significantly higher number of people than does the average infected person.

surgical mask.Descricao: Half-face mask, flat and rectangular in shape, made of nonwoven fabric and comprising filtration layers, with folds and elastic bands or long straight ties that can be looped behind a personâ€™s ears or tied around a personâ€™s head, which is used to protect the wearer from sprays, splashes, and large-particle droplets and to prevent the spread of respiratory droplets from the wearer to others.

suspected case.Descricao: Case that is compatible with a clinical case definition but there is no laboratory test confirmation or strong epidemiological evidence, e.g. the person is not a contact of a confirmed case.

swab.Descricao: Piece of soft material used by a healthcare professional for cleaning wounds or taking samples from a personâ€™s body for testing purposes.

swab test.Descricao: Method of collecting a sample of organic material for diagnostic purposes by inserting a swab into a personâ€™s body orifices, e.g. nose, mouth, etc. MEDI,

symptom.Descricao: Manifestation of a disease that is perceptible to only the patient (subjective symptom) or to the patient and others (objective symptom or sign).

symptomatic transmission.Descricao: Mode of transmission to another person of an infectious disease from an infected person who has developed symptoms.

systemic inflammatory response syndrome.Descricao: (syn.) SIRS   Condition characterized by a disproportionate inflammatory response to a variety of severe clinical phenomena, including relating to body temperature (>38Â°C or <36Â°C), heart rate (>90 beats per minute), respiratory rate (>20 breaths per minute or PaCO2 <32 mmHg), and white blood cell count (>12,000/cu mm, <4,000/cu mm, or >10% immature band forms).

telehealth.Descricao: Remote provision of clinical and non-clinical services using information and communication technologies, such as diagnosis and treatment of diseases and injuries, research and evaluation, and education of health professionals.

thrombosis.Descricao: Vascular disease involving the formation of thrombi inside a blood vessel, i.e. an artery or a vein, obstructing circulation.

triage.Descricao: Process of sorting patients or casualties to determine priority of need and proper place of treatment.

urgent care.Descricao: Medical care provided for illnesses or injuries that require prompt attention but are typically not so serious as to require the services of an emergency room.

urgent care facility.Descricao: (syn.) urgent care center   A walk-in clinic led by qualified medical professionals, i.e. doctors and nurses, in which urgent care is delivered.

vaccine.Descricao: Therapeutic preparation containing an antigen, i.e. a virus or a segment of a virus or a toxin generated by bacteria, that may have been attenuated, inactivated or killed and which is able to trigger the immune response and generate immunity in an organism.

vector.Descricao: Living organism that indirectly transmits an infectious disease to a susceptible host either by carrying the infectious agent on its body (mechanical vector) or by providing an environment in which the infectious agent can reproduce and survive (biological vector).

viral load.Descricao: Amount of viral particles present in a millilitre of a fluid sample, e.g. blood.

viral vector.Descricao: Virus that has been genetically modified for use in gene therapy.

virus.Descricao: Microscopic infectious agent that can multiply only in living cells of animals, plants, or bacteria, consisting of genetic material, either DNA or RNA, housed inside a capsid.

X-ray image.Descricao: Image formed by the shadows of the objects inside a patientâ€™s body when x-rays travel through it and pass through an x-ray detector on the other side of the patient.

zoonosis.Descricao: Infectious disease that is transmissible under natural conditions from vertebrate animals to humans.
